title: Soccer Vocabulary
description: From offsides to bicycle kicks, test your knowledge of soccer terms!

questions.question: In soccer, what is the 'offside' rule?
options: A player is penalized for being on the wrong side of the halfway line
A player cannot stand outside the field boundaries
A goalkeeper cannot leave the penalty box
An attacking player cannot be nearer to the goal line than both the ball and the second-to-last defender when the ball is played to them
questions.explanation: The offside rule states a player is offside if they are nearer to the opponent's goal line than both the ball and the second-to-last defender at the moment the ball is played to them.

questions.question: What is a 'hat-trick' in soccer?
options: Three assists in a match
Three consecutive wins
Performing three tricks with the ball
Scoring three goals in one match by the same player
questions.explanation: A hat-trick is when a single player scores three goals in one match, considered a remarkable individual achievement in soccer.

questions.question: In soccer, what is a 'bicycle kick' (or 'overhead kick')?
options: An acrobatic kick where the player kicks the ball overhead while falling backward
A kick taken from the sideline
Pedaling the legs while running
Kicking the ball while riding a bicycle
questions.explanation: A bicycle kick is a spectacular acrobatic shot where a player throws their body backward into the air and kicks the ball over their own head, often resulting in spectacular goals.

questions.question: What does 'stoppage time' (or 'injury time') mean in soccer?
options: The time it takes to stop the game clock
Additional time added at the end of each half to compensate for delays
A mandatory break midway through each half
Time when play is stopped for injuries only
questions.explanation: Stoppage time is additional time added by the referee at the end of each half to compensate for time lost due to substitutions, injuries, time-wasting, and other stoppages.

questions.question: In soccer, what is a 'nutmeg'?
options: A type of defensive tackle
A spice used to mark the field
A header scored from a corner kick
Passing the ball through an opponent's legs
questions.explanation: A nutmeg is the act of kicking or passing the ball between an opponent's legs and collecting it on the other side, considered a skilful and often humiliating move.

questions.question: What is a 'clean sheet' in soccer?
options: A match in which a team does not concede any goals
A player receiving no fouls
A referee's blank notebook
A new score sheet at the start of a season
questions.explanation: A clean sheet is when a team (particularly the goalkeeper and defense) prevents the opposition from scoring any goals throughout the entire match.

questions.question: In soccer, what is a 'free kick'?
options: A kick taken without a goalkeeper
A kick that doesn't count toward the score
A kick awarded to a team after a foul by the opposition
A practice kick before the match
questions.explanation: A free kick is awarded after a foul and can be direct (a goal can be scored directly) or indirect (the ball must touch another player before a goal can be scored).

questions.question: What is a 'derby' in soccer?
options: A horse-racing themed tournament
A cup competition for amateur teams
A match between two local rival teams
A style of defensive play
questions.explanation: A derby (or local derby) is a match between two teams from the same city or region, often characterized by intense rivalry and passionate support.

questions.question: In soccer, what is the 'wall' during a free kick?
options: A line of defending players standing together to block the kick
The goalpost
The barrier around the stadium
A tactical formation
questions.explanation: The wall is a line of defending players who stand shoulder to shoulder at least 9.15 meters from the ball to block or deflect the free kick.

questions.question: What does 'aggregate score' mean in soccer?
options: The combined score over two legs (home and away) of a knockout tie
The average score of a season
The highest individual scorer's total
The score at halftime
questions.explanation: Aggregate score is the combined total of goals scored by each team across both legs (home and away matches) in a two-legged knockout tie.

questions.question: In soccer, what is 'parking the bus'?
options: The team bus arriving at the stadium
A celebratory team ride after winning
A highly defensive strategy with most players behind the ball
Blocking the entrance to the field
questions.explanation: 'Parking the bus' is a colloquial term for an extremely defensive tactic where a team puts nearly all its players behind the ball to protect a lead or earn a draw.

questions.question: What is a 'penalty shootout' in soccer?
options: A punishment for excessive goal celebrations
A shooting practice session
A penalty for shooting too hard
A tiebreaker method where teams take alternating penalty kicks
questions.explanation: A penalty shootout is used to decide a match that remains tied after extra time, with each team taking alternating penalty kicks, typically five each initially.

questions.question: In soccer, what is a 'through ball'?
options: A ball that goes through a player's legs
A pass played into space behind the defense for a teammate to run onto
A ball kicked through the goal net
A shot that goes through the goalkeeper's hands
questions.explanation: A through ball is an attacking pass played into the space behind the defensive line for a teammate to run onto, requiring precise timing and vision.

questions.question: What does 'VAR' stand for in modern soccer?
options: Verified Athletic Result
Visual Assessment Review
Variable Action Replay
Video Assistant Referee
questions.explanation: VAR stands for Video Assistant Referee, a system introduced to help match officials make correct decisions using video replays for goals, penalties, red cards, and mistaken identity.

questions.question: In soccer, what is a 'brace'?
options: A defensive pairing of two players
Two goals scored by the same player in one match
A type of throw-in
A knee support worn by players
questions.explanation: A brace refers to a player scoring two goals in a single match. Scoring three goals is a hat-trick.
